intro: Dasyaulus firmus, commonly known as the rigid dasyaulus, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the family Najadaceae. It is characterized by its dense, ribbon-like leaves that are typically submerged in freshwater environments. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving waters, often found in ponds and lakes. Its root system helps stabilize the sediment, contributing to water clarity. Dasyaulus firmus plays a role in providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
